page.title: 08Housing in Milton Keynes
page.content: There are lots of different types of houses in West Bletchley.Most people in our school live in semi-detached houses.There are also terraced houses, flats,maisonettes and there is one tower block of 21 storeys. Most houses have central heating and gas fires.Very few people have open fires.Most houses also have garages and gardens.Most people are buying their own houses. The houses in Coffee Hall are built from white breeze blocks.They are terraced houses which had flat roofs,but this led to leaking so now they have pitched roofs.The houses at Beanhill and Netherfield are both made of corrugated materials.Beanhill houses are bungalows and in Netherfield the houses can be 1,2 or 3 storeys high and are built in long terraces of 50-60 houses.
